verb.description: To put (a thing) in a place, especially for storage or safe keeping; to repose, deposit.
To restore to a place or position; especially (Surgery) to restore to the normal position.

origin: Late 18th century (in an earlier sense). In sense 1 either from reposit, or shortened from repository<br>mid 17th century; earliest use found in Henry Lord (b. 1563), clergyman and ethnographer. From classical Latin reposit-, past participial stem of repōnere repone.
